page.title: 17THE HURTWOOD INN
page.content: The Hurtwood Inn used to be a bakery. It has been an Hotel since l920. It has l8 bedrooms, l0 bathrooms, l lounge, l dining room and two bars.It can accommodate 40 guests. There are ten full time staff, six live in and four live nearby. The food comes from Trust House Forte stores in London. Linen goes away to be laundered. There is a dishwasher in the kitchen. Most mid-week guests are business men. At the weekend they are on holiday. The average stay is two to three days. More foreign tourists than English people use the hotel (mostly Americans, Germans and Dutch). Spring and Autumn are the busiest times of the year. Local people only use the hotel occasionally for such things as wedding receptions or parties.
